line_1: Would do the bride so great a favour,
line_2: But not a flow'r of scent or flavour

line_1: Grant me yet this one poor favour,
line_2: Let us each go on for ever,

line_1: Both rais'd, but by their Party's Favor.
line_2: No Merit in their own Behav'or:

line_1: I now grew out of Pluto's Favour,
line_2: Who grumbl'd at my late Behaviour;

line_1: And Airy be recompens'd well for that Favour,
line_2: If your Friend, in Return, should make him grow graver.

line_1: Then hinted, as a special favour,
line_2: What gave it that delicious flavour;

line_1: Once on a time to gain her favour;
line_2: A smock which Pallas spun and gave her

line_1: Indulg'd, as a Token of PROSERPINE's Favour,
line_2: To preside at her Balls in a cream-colour'd Beaver:

line_1: Then patronize them wvi' your favor,
